classes.name: SwValueCont
classes.note: This metaclass represents the content of one particular SwInstance.

swArraysize.note: This attribute defines the size of each dimension for CURVE, MAP, CUBOID, CUBE_4, RES_AXIS, VAL_BLK. dimension one value has to be defined, e.g. one of COM_AXIS and two or more in case of MAP.

swValuesPhys.note: swValuesPhys represents the values in the physical

unit.note: This represents the physical unit of the provided values.

unitDisplay.note: This specifies how the physical units of the current value set shall be displayed in documents or in user interfaces

classes.name: SwAxisCont
classes.note: This represents the values for the axis of a compound primitive (curve, map). For standard and fix axes, SwAxisCont contains the values of the axis directly. The axis values of SwAxisCont with the category COM_AXIS, RES_AXIS are for display only. For editing and processing, only the values in the related GroupAxis are binding.

category.note: This category specifies the particular axis types: STD_AXIS (swArraysize necessary)

swArraysize.note: For multidimensional compound primitivies (curve, map is necessary to know the dimensions.They are swArraySize.

swAxisIndex.note: This property allows to explicitly assign the axis contents particular axis. It is specified by numbers where 1 the x-axis. It is also possible to derive the from the sequence of the parent.

swValuesPhys.note: swValuesPhys represents the values in the physical

unit.note: This represents the physical unit of the provided values.

unitDisplay.note: This represents the display name which is used for the physical unit of the axis.

classes.name: SwValues
classes.note: that numerical values and textual values should not be mixed.

v.note: This is a non variant Value. It is provided for sake of ASAM CDF.

vf.note: This allows to specify the value as VariationPoint. It is non variant for sake of compatibility to 2.0.

vg.note: This allows to have intersections in the values in order to rendering (eg. using stylesheets). For is important that the v values are always the same (flattened) order and the tool is interpret it without respecting vg.

vt.note: This represents the values of textual data elements that vt uses the | to separate the values for bitfield masks in case that the semantics of DataPrototype is described by means of a the associated CompuMethod.

vtf.note: This aggregation represents the ability to provide a value either numerical or text which existence is subject formal point of view, the aggregation needs to multiplicity 1 because SwValues is modelled with Nevertheless, the existence of optional and subject to constraints. atpVariation

classes.name: ValueGroup
classes.note: This element enables values to be grouped. It can be used to perform row and column-orientated groupings, so that these can be rendered properly e.g. as a table.

label.note: This label allows to give the valueGroup a particular It can be used if the Values are rendered as a

vgContents.note: This represents the contents of the value group.
